metadata.title: CVE-2017-16942 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
In libsndfile 1.0.25 (fixed in 1.0.26), a divide-by-zero error exists inthe function wav_w64_read_fmt_chunk() in wav_w64.c, which may lead to DoSwhen playing a crafted audio file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16942` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsndfile1 - 1.0.25-10ubuntu0.16.04.2
sndfile-programs - 1.0.25-10ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsndfile package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.25-10ubuntu0.16.04.2').
